refnamediv.refpurpose: Groups of global keyboard accelerators for an entire GtkWindow

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: accel-activate : Has Details accel-changed : Run First / Has Details

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkAccelGroup represents a group of keyboard accelerators, typically attached to a toplevel GtkWindow (with gtk_window_add_accel_group()). Usually you won't need to create a GtkAccelGroup directly; instead, when using GtkItemFactory, GTK+ automatically sets up the accelerators for your menus in the item factory's GtkAccelGroup.

Note that accelerators are different from mnemonics. Accelerators are shortcuts for activating a menu item; they appear alongside the menu item they're a shortcut for. For example "Ctrl+Q" might appear alongside the "Quit" menu item. Mnemonics are shortcuts for GUI elements such as text entries or buttons; they appear as underlined characters. See gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(). Menu items can have both accelerators and mnemonics, of course.

refsect2.title: GtkAccelGroup
refsect2.para: An object representing and maintaining a group of accelerators.

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkAccelGroup.

listitem.simpara: a new GtkAccelGroup object

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_ref

warning.para: gtk_accel_group_ref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated equivalent of g_object_ref().

listitem.simpara: the accel group that was passed in

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_unref

warning.para: gtk_accel_group_unref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated equivalent of g_object_unref().

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_connect ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_accel_group_connect (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods, GtkAccelFlags accel_flags, GClosure *closure);
refsect2.para: Installs an accelerator in this group. When accel_group is being activated in response to a call to gtk_accel_groups_activate(), closure will be invoked if the accel_key and accel_mods from gtk_accel_groups_activate() match those of this connection.
The signature used for the closure is that of GtkAccelGroupActivate.
Note that, due to implementation details, a single closure can only be connected to one accelerator group.

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in
key value of the accelerator
modifier combination of the accelerator
a flag mask to configure this accelerator
closure to be executed upon accelerator activation

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_connect_by_path ()
refsect2.para: Installs an accelerator in this group, using an accelerator path to look up the appropriate key and modifiers (see gtk_accel_map_add_entry()). When accel_group is being activated in response to a call to gtk_accel_groups_activate(), closure will be invoked if the accel_key and accel_mods from gtk_accel_groups_activate() match the key and modifiers for the path.
The signature used for the closure is that of GtkAccelGroupActivate.

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in
path used for determining key and modifiers.
closure to be executed upon accelerator activation

refsect2.title: GtkAccelGroupActivate ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean (*GtkAccelGroupActivate) (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, GObject *acceleratable, guint keyval, GdkModifierType modifier);

refsect2.title: GtkAccelGroupFindFunc ()
refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_disconnect ()
refsect2.para: Removes an accelerator previously installed through gtk_accel_group_connect().

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to remove an accelerator from
the closure to remove from this accelerator group
TRUE if the closure was found and got disconnected

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_disconnect_key ()
refsect2.para: Removes an accelerator previously installed through gtk_accel_group_connect().

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in
key value of the accelerator
modifier combination of the accelerator
TRUE if there was an accelerator which could be removed, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_query ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkAccelGroupEntry* gtk_accel_group_query (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods, guint *n_entries);
refsect2.para: Queries an accelerator group for all entries matching accel_key and accel_mods.

listitem.simpara: the accelerator group to query
key value of the accelerator
modifier combination of the accelerator
location to return the number of entries found, or NULL
an array of n_entries GtkAccelGroupEntry elements, or NULL. The array is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed.

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_activate ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_accel_group_activate (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, GQuark accel_quark, GObject *acceleratable, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods);

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_lock ()
refsect2.para: Locks the given accelerator group.
Locking an acelerator group prevents the accelerators contained within it to be changed during runtime. Refer to gtk_accel_map_change_entry() about runtime accelerator changes.
If called more than once, accel_group remains locked until gtk_accel_group_unlock() has been called an equivalent number of times.

listitem.simpara: a GtkAccelGroup

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_unlock ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the last call to gtk_accel_group_lock() on this accel_group.

listitem.simpara: a GtkAccelGroup

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_from_accel_closure ()
refsect2.para: Finds the GtkAccelGroup to which closure is connected; see gtk_accel_group_connect().

listitem.simpara: a GClosure
the GtkAccelGroup to which closure is connected, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_groups_activate ()
refsect2.para: Finds the first accelerator in any GtkAccelGroup attached to object that matches accel_key and accel_mods, and activates that accelerator. If an accelerator was activated and handled this keypress, TRUE is returned.

listitem.simpara: the GObject, usually a GtkWindow, on which to activate the accelerator.
accelerator keyval from a key event
keyboard state mask from a key event
TRUE if the accelerator was handled, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_groups_from_object ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of all accel groups which are attached to object.

listitem.simpara: a GObject, usually a GtkWindow
a list of all accel groups which are attached to object

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_group_find ()
refsect2.para: Finds the first entry in an accelerator group for which find_func returns TRUE and returns its GtkAccelKey.

listitem.simpara: a GtkAccelGroup
a function to filter the entries of accel_group with
data to pass to find_func
the key of the first entry passing find_func. The key is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed.

refsect2.title: GtkAccelKey
gtk_accelerator_valid ()
refsect2.para: Determines whether a given keyval and modifier mask constitute a valid keyboard accelerator. For example, the GDK_a keyval plus GDK_CONTROL_MASK is valid - this is a "Ctrl+a" accelerator. But, you can't, for instance, use the GDK_Control_L keyval as an accelerator.

listitem.simpara: a GDK keyval
modifier mask
TRUE if the accelerator is valid

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_parse ()
refsect2.para: Parses a string representing an accelerator. The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1" or "<Release>z" (the last one is for key release). The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>".
If the parse fails, accelerator_key and accelerator_mods will be set to 0 (zero).

listitem.simpara: string representing an accelerator
return location for accelerator keyval
return location for accelerator modifier mask

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_name ()
refsect2.para: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by gtk_accelerator_parse(). For example, if you pass in GDK_q and GDK_CONTROL_MASK, this function returns "<Control>q".
If you need to display accelerators in the user interface, see gtk_accelerator_get_label().

listitem.simpara: accelerator keyval
accelerator modifier mask
a newly-allocated accelerator name

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_get_label ()
refsect2.para: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string which can be used to represent the accelerator to the user.

listitem.simpara: accelerator keyval
accelerator modifier mask
a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_set_default_mod_mask ()
refsect2.para: Sets the modifiers that will be considered significant for keyboard accelerators. The default mod mask is GDK_CONTROL_MASK | GDK_SHIFT_MASK | GDK_MOD1_MASK | GDK_SUPER_MASK | GDK_HYPER_MASK | GDK_META_MASK, that is, Control, Shift, Alt, Super, Hyper and Meta. Other modifiers will by default be ignored by GtkAccelGroup. You must include at least the three modifiers Control, Shift and Alt in any value you pass to this function.
The default mod mask should be changed on application startup, before using any accelerator groups.

listitem.simpara: accelerator modifier mask

refsect2.title: gtk_accelerator_get_default_mod_mask ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_accelerator_set_default_mod_mask().

listitem.simpara: the default accelerator modifier mask

refsect2.title: The ::accel-activate signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, GObject *acceleratable, guint keyval, GdkModifierType modifier, gpointer user_data) : Has Details
refsect2.para: The accel-activate signal is an implementation detail of GtkAccelGroup and not meant to be used by applications.

listitem.simpara: the GtkAccelGroup which received the signal
the object on which the accelerator was activated
the accelerator keyval
the modifier combination of the accelerator
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE if the accelerator was activated

refsect2.title: The ::accel-changed signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAccelGroup *accel_group, guint keyval, GdkModifierType modifier, GClosure *accel_closure, gpointer user_data) : Run First / Has Details
refsect2.para: The accel-changed signal is emitted when a GtkAccelGroupEntry is added to or removed from the accel group.
Widgets like GtkAccelLabel which display an associated accelerator should connect to this signal, and rebuild their visual representation if the accel_closure is theirs.

listitem.simpara: the GtkAccelGroup which received the signal
the accelerator keyval
the modifier combination of the accelerator
the GClosure of the accelerator
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
